item.title: Quick & Flavorful Vegan Recipes for Busy Nights
item.description: Weeknight dinners donâ€™t have to be a hassle! These quick vegan meals are loaded with fresh veggies and spices thatâ€™ll make your taste buds dance. Perfect for busy evenings or meal prep. Save this for your next cooking adventure!
item.dc:creator: author_001
item.content:encoded:
â±ï¸ Prep Time: 15 minutes

ğŸ³ Cook Time: 30 minutes

â° Total Time: N/A minutes

ğŸ½ï¸ Servings: 4

ğŸ“Š Difficulty: Easy

ğŸ¥˜ Ingredients

  • 1 cup quinoa, rinsed and drained
  • 2 cups vegetable broth (or water)
  • 1 bell pepper, diced
  • 1 zucchini, chopped
  • 1 can black beans, drained and rinsed
  • 1 teaspoon cumin
  • 1 teaspoon chili powder
  • Salt and pepper to taste
  • Fresh cilantro for garnish

ğŸ‘©â€ğŸ³ Instructions

  1. Start by cooking your quinoa. Bring the vegetable broth to a boil in a medium saucepan, add the rinsed quinoa, and reduce to a simmer. Cover and cook for about 15 minutes until the liquid is absorbed.
  2. While thatâ€™s cooking, heat a splash of olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Toss in your diced bell pepper and chopped zucchini. SautÃ© for about 5-7 minutes until theyâ€™re tender and slightly caramelized.
  3. Next, add the drained black beans, cumin, chili powder, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Mix everything together and let it cook for another 5 minutes to let those flavors combine.
  4. Once the quinoa is done, fluff it up with a fork and combine it with the sautÃ©ed veggies and beans. Stir it all together until well mixed.
  5. Serve warm, garnished with fresh cilantro. Dig in and enjoy!
